channel.title: Network Cmds on Techtaste
channel.description: Recent content in Network Cmds on Techtaste

item.title: TCPDUMP cmd
item.description: tcpdump -i any To get the network packets from all network interfaces, run the following command, get packets on localhost with port 8288 tcpdump -i lo0 port 8288 tcpdump -i eth0 get the network packets from a single interface tcpdump -i eth0 -w wirte_file_name write all the captured packets to a file, use the ‘-w’ option, tcpdump -r packets_file read an already created, old tcpdump file.

item.title: Linux network commands
item.description: Ifconfig Used to configure network interface parameters. Checking ip of the machine. traceroute Print the route packets take to network host. dig(Domain information groper) Dig (domain information groper) query DNS related information like A Record, CNAME, MX Record etc telnet Connects to host on given port using telnet protocal. If connection successful then host is working fine. nslookup It queries internet domain name servers. Options
